snippet: The Rent Guidelines Board is proposing to allow rent increases for tenants living in about one million rent-stabilized apartments in New York City.
abstract: New York City's Rent Guidelines Board, citing poor attendance in recent years, eliminates public hearing that has traditionally been held in the Bronx, Brooklyn or Queens since 2005; remaining public hearing will be held in Lower Manhattan on June 13;  board is proposing to allow rent increases for tenants living in about one million rent-stabilized apartments throughout city.
lead_paragraph: The Rent Guidelines Board is proposing to allow rent increases for tenants living in about one million rent-stabilized apartments in New York City.

headline.seo: Rent Board Trims Roster of Hearings on Increases
headline.main: Rent Board Trims Roster of Hearings on Increases
headline.print_headline: Rent Board Trims Roster Of Hearings On Increases
